11:52 <gdelhumeau> test2  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> I was reporting XWIKI-10360  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> oops  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> note this one  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> but XWIKI-10421  
12:25 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: hi, i've reverted the commit (rendering cache fix)  
12:37 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: ok thanks  
12:38 <DarkKnightCZ> no problem  
12:39 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: why did you introduced flushcahce api in XWikiDocument ? AFAIK there is already support for refresh=1 in the URL when you want to force refreshing the cache  
12:39 <tmortagne> s/flushcahce/flushcache/  
12:40 <tmortagne> it's taken into account at com.xpn.xwiki.internal.cache.rendering.DefaultRenderingCache AFAICS  
12:42 <DarkKnightCZ> because refresh=1 can only be used for current request... if you need to programatically flush rendering cache, there is no way how to do that (for example if you listen on document change, so you can flush cache of document that uses that document's data)  
12:43 <tmortagne> why no an API at RenderingCache then ?  
12:43 <tmortagne> make more sense to me  
12:44 <tmortagne> (you can reset the whole cache by initialize() I think BTW)  
12:44 <tmortagne> s/by/by calling/  
12:45 <tmortagne> sorry lunch time, bb in 1 or 2h  
12:47 <DarkKnightCZ> yeah, good point... frankly i cannot remember now, why exactly i added that to document... probably because i didn't know if renderingcache has visible API  
12:47 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
12:55 <Lyes> has quit  
13:16 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
13:18 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <webczat> Hello. I believe making a plugin to sync xwiki users to ldap may have problems.  
13:40 <webczat> At least in case of making it for general public.  
14:04 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: actually RenderingCache is in internal package so it's not that public  
14:14 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: the code you added is not very XWiki codestyle, you should use the formater configuration we have on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentTools#HCheckstyle  
14:15 <tmortagne> (maybe it's actually not your code, not sure what is yours and what come from the other PR)  
14:26 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yeah, most of it isn't my code... i will look at the checkstyle  
14:30 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: does not make much sense to me that RenderingCacheAware system is only supported for plugins, plugins that are totally deprecated techno and skinx is not rewritten as component just because we did not had time yet  
14:31 <tmortagne> it's almost the same as explicitely checking for skin extension plugin  
14:35 <cjd> Mr tmortagne, I've a question. What do you make of this?  https://ezcrypt.it/YG8n#00uwuy1iE2SuAcXA3HLA73pJ  
14:35 <cjd> I set dependency version constraint to [1.1,   and it seems to try to find exactly that version  
14:36 <tmortagne> cjd: looks like a nullpointer badly written by the displayer, you should have the detailes exception in the related status.xml  
14:37 <tmortagne> the issue seems to be "Caused by: $throwable.class: null"  
14:37 <cjd> ./data/jobs/status/extension/action/calebjamesdelisle%3Artwiki/wiki%3Axwiki/status.xml  
14:37 <cjd> ./data/jobs/status/distribution/status.xml  
14:37 <cjd> first or second?  
14:37 <tmortagne> the one related to the extension you tried to install  
14:37 <tmortagne> ./data/jobs/status/distribution/status.xml is generated by the distribution wizard  
14:38 <tmortagne> you have a statux.xml generated for each job (as long as the job have an id)  
14:38 <cjd> http://sprunge.us/eADR  
14:39 <cjd> ahh ok this is probably because I'm not releasing through maven and instead just making the objects on extensions.xwiki.org  
14:40 <cjd> is that a sensible line of thinking?  
14:41 <ClemensR> well, it looks like it checks on http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public  first and drops dead when not finding it there. I thought that should be allowed (i.e. not being on nexus.xwiki.org first)  and it goes on to the next repo then  
14:42 <tmortagne> cjd: no, version range is resolved client side so it does not matter from where your extension is coming from  
14:43 <msmeria> has quit  
14:43 <tmortagne> cjd: according to the stack trace looks like EM is ending up with version "[1.1," which is not a valid range  
14:43 <tmortagne> you really have that in one of your extensions or is it a bug in EM ?  
14:44 <cjd> that's not a valid range?  
14:44 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: you would still need to modify AbstractSkinExtensionPlugin to achieve such functionality (but in the other way around, i can hardly think of any other usage of that interface)  
14:44 <cjd> I put it as the constraint because it is written that way in the documetation  
14:44 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
14:44 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <cjd> ``Dependency version constraint is the version related information of the dependency. Can be a version (e.g. 1.0) or one or several ranges of versions based on Maven standard syntax (e.g. [1.0,) which mean at least 1.0)''  
14:45 <tmortagne> it's written "[1.0,)"  
14:45 <tmortagne> not "[1.0,"  
14:45 <cjd> ahh, let me fix that documentation  
14:45 <cjd> oh I see, it is correct, just hard to read  
14:46 <cjd> fixed, thanks for this hand-holding session  
14:47 <tmortagne> not sure what "[1.1," end up meaning here, does not seems to crash  
14:47 <tmortagne> will check that, at least if it doing crap it should throw an exception for invalid range syntax  
14:50 <cjd> /nod  
14:54 <gdelhumeau> Guys, I wonder where is the implementation of xwiki-platform-birdge?  
14:54 <vmassol> in oldcore  
14:54 <vmassol> I believe  
14:54 <vmassol> you can ask intellij ;)  
14:55 <vmassol> for ex: com.xpn.xwiki.doc.DefaultDocumentAccessBridge  
14:55 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
14:56 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: my point is that if we convert the skin extension plugin as a component then we get back the issue because your patch only support extension comming from plugins  
14:57 <cjd> 14:54 < vmassol> you can ask intellij  <-- this is kind of a problem because when you're able to create code which people can't read without IDEA, you've made a barrier of entry to the project.  
14:57 <vmassol> or eclipse  
14:57 <vmassol> or netbeans  
14:57 <vmassol> or your favorite text editor  
14:57 <vmassol> or grep  
14:57 <vmassol> ...  
14:58 <vmassol> but guillaume is using intelij  
14:58 <vmassol> intelilij  
14:58 <cjd> just a small suggestion :)  you're the chef  
14:58 <vmassol> so your suggestion is to have one single big file because it's too complex to have more than 1 file  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: weird, intellij did not show me  
14:58 <vmassol> nice idea!  
14:59 <vmassol> it won't show you if the module is not enabled  
14:59 <vmassol> (greyed out in the list of maven modules)  
14:59 <vmassol> but not having oldcore is strange since not much else will work  
15:02 <vmassol> @cjd: we tried this in the past (well ludovic tried it), it's called XWiki.java ;)  
15:02 <cjd> :)  
15:07 <cjd> hmm cool, we're requiring java7 so we can now upgrade to jetty9 which (along with a little documentation) will fix XWIKI-10408  
15:09 <vmassol> yes cool  
15:09 <vmassol> and jetty9 is servlet 3.0+  
15:09 <vmassol> one more step towards moving to servlet 3+  
15:12 <Lyes> has quit  
15:13 <cjd> I'm mostly excited about the long term prospect of being able to trust xwiki/jetty/mysql as production ready  
15:13 <cjd> apache mod\_proxy -> jetty/xwiki bundle -> mysql  
15:15 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <Lyes> has quit  
15:16 <cjd> vmassol: not sure if you saw this but it's interesting: http://www.joelonsoftware.com/articles/fog0000000007.html  
15:17 <cjd> "The Excel development team will never accept it," he said. "You know their motto? 'Find the dependencies -- and eliminate them.'  
15:18 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
15:18 <Lyes> has left #xwiki  
15:19 <Lyes> has left #xwiki  
15:19 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <vmassol> cjd: sure, nothing new here  
15:23 <vmassol> the key is "If it's a core business function -- do it yourself, no matter what."  
15:24 <cjd> Yeah, which comes down to "what is core and what is side"  
15:24 <vmassol> yup and build isn't core ;)  
15:25 <cjd> it was to the ckedit people :)  
15:25 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: added a suggestion about RenderingCacheAware that should be ok IMO  
15:26 <tmortagne> enough to apply the PR at least and allow any component to declare cache item extension like skinx do  
15:26 <vmassol> cjd: lots of people do mistakes, nothing new here either  
15:26 <cjd> vmassol: actually I would say that fundimentally we're a web-dev shop (xwiki sas is anyway) and the secret sauce for a web-dev shop is the process, we have a faster process which can make a better product so we win. Our process is based on the fact that most people want the same kind of thing and we can build that once for everyone...  
15:26 <cjd> but basically anything which makes us more productive is core  
15:27 <cjd> IM(ns)HO  
15:27 <tmortagne> ckeditor was not that advanced when we started working on WYSIWYG and GWT looked like magically getting us a WYSIWYG  
15:27 <vmassol> yeah sure, let's invent a new language  
15:27 <vmassol> oh no wait  
15:27 <vmassol> let's invent a new computer  
15:27 <vmassol> that's faster  
15:27 <vmassol> a quantic one!  
15:27 <cjd> \*quantum  
15:27 <vmassol> so we get an edge over the competition  
15:27 <cjd> that's NSA secret sauce  
15:27 <vmassol> yeah!  
15:27 <cjd> of course there are limits :)  
15:28 <vmassol> exactly  
15:28 <cjd> probably something that could be mathmatically calculated... "how much RoI must an improvement to process offer in order to be worthwhile"  
15:28 <cjd> sounds like a paper heh  
15:28 <vmassol> it's not possible and it's useless  
15:29 <vmassol> I've done this countless of time in the past for customers  
15:29 <vmassol> and it never worked  
15:29 <vmassol> you just get to prove what you want in the end  
15:29 <vmassol> by adjusting the parameters the way you want  
15:29 <vmassol> to get the result  
15:29 <cjd> You know Mark Twain?  
15:29 <vmassol> haven't read it (or just portions)  
15:30 <vmassol> s/it/him  
15:30 <cjd> A quote of his is "there are three types of lies, there are lies, there are damn lies and there are statistics"  
15:30 <vmassol> yup  
15:30 <vmassol> I know this quote  
15:30 <cjd> big data makes this worse because we can now find enough data to prove anything we care to  
15:30 <vmassol> indeed  
15:30 <cjd> so we're back to trying to guess where the line is  
15:38 <Lyes> has quit

17:45 <vmassol> is that the cache issue we have sometimes?

18:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you remind me how to flush the aether cache?  
18:49 <mflorea> has quit  
18:50 <vmassol> ok found it  
18:50 <vmassol> I think  
18:50 <tmortagne> vmassol: sudo rm -rf /usr/local/tomcat/work/Catalina/localhost/xwiki/xwiki-temp/aether-repository  
18:50 <vmassol> yep  
18:50 <vmassol> had just found it :)  
18:51 <vmassol> works  
18:52 <tmortagne> I totally workaround aether cache in  so we should probably upgrade to 6.0.1  
18:52 <tmortagne> s/in/in 6.0/  
18:52 <vmassol> indeed we're still using 5.4.3 on xwiki.org  
18:52 <tmortagne> it wil fix that issue among other things

22:48 <grimeton> hi  
22:48 <grimeton> i installed a plain xwiki  
22:48 <grimeton> enabled the superadmin because the default login didn't work  
22:48 <grimeton> then added the xar archive with the default stuff  
22:48 <grimeton> and changed the Admin password  
22:48 <grimeton> then i restartet the xwiki process and get a stackoverflowerror right at the start  
22:48 <grimeton> and the connection is reset when i try to access the server
